alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong winds will be possible across portions of Brown, Coleman and northern McCulloch Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 438 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking several developing showers and thunderstorm from near Cross Cut southwest to Ivie Reservoir. These showers and storms are moving northeast at 25 mph. Wind gusts over 50 mph will be possible from any of these showers and storms, even with activity where little rainfall actually reaches the ground. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Coleman, Early, Santa Anna, Bangs, Blanket, Gouldbusk, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Burkett, May, Cross Cut, Zephyr, Brookesmith, Rockwood, Voss, Waldrip, Lake Brownwood State Park, Silver Valley, Leaday and Lake Brownwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
